description: Ms. codex. Physical description: 16-17 lines per page; written in naskhī and taʻlīq scripts in black on white glazed paper. Captions in red.
author: Iznīqī, ʻAlī, active 15th century
contents: 2. fol. 61b-70a: A treatise inspired by alchemic passages found in the works of Jābir ibn Ḥayyān, al-Ghazālī, Sulṭān al-Ẓāhir Baybars, and the Mamlūk Sulṭān Barqūq. First 6 fol. are in Arabic, the remainder in Ottoman Turkish.
extent: 72 leaves, bound : paper ; 235 x 145 (163 x 87) mm.
title: Mecmuat ül-mücerrebat min ül-kâf.
provenance: Ownership entry and stamp on fol. 1a by Jalāl al-Dīn, dated 1292 A.H. (1875-6).
creator: ازنيقي، علي.
subject: Alchemy—Islamic Empire—15th century
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
